comments:
Found this in the log:
java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.memory.MemoryViewSynchronizationService.memoryBlocksRemoved(MemoryViewSynchronizationService.java:152)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.MemoryBlockManager$MemoryBlockNotifier.run(MemoryBlockManager.java:70)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.MemoryBlockManager$MemoryBlockNotifier.notify(MemoryBlockManager.java:88)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.MemoryBlockManager.notifyListeners(MemoryBlockManager.java:250)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.MemoryBlockManager.removeMemoryBlocks(MemoryBlockManager.java:163)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.MemoryBlockManager.handleDebugEvent(MemoryBlockManager.java:278)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.MemoryBlockManager.handleDebugEvents(MemoryBlockManager.java:258)
at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$EventNotifier.run(DebugPlugin.java:1074)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$EventNotifier.dispatch(DebugPlugin.java:1108)
at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$EventDispatchJob.run(DebugPlugin.java:360)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Added null check to avoid NPE.  fSynchronizeInfo can be null if the service is already shut down when it recevies the memory block removed event.
